column52: This survey is for the Westhouse Hotel NYC only, Park Central will be on the separate proposal. We can combine it if they need it. The property is one of our existing hotels. The sales agent is Stephen Nichols. Park Central NYC and Westhouse NYC hotels are located in the same building. Park Central levels are from B1 to the 18th floor, and the Westhouse Floors are 19-25th. They used to be together, but they were separated later on. They have different networks and different PMS, but they were running from the same ZD3050. We will do vSCG and separate them completely, so for our NOC it will be much easier to identify the issue and there will not be going to share the same network. The only network equipment they will use the same, the ISP feed, and the ISP switch that is in Park Central's MDF. The ISP switch will send the feed to both directions. The Westhouse Fusion is active in support and fairly new. We won't replace it, but will add the 10G NIC to it. We will replace the Core SW with a 1x 7450-48P 8x10G switch. The Westhouse IDF on the 22nd floor is already a 50/125 MM fiber (by the old network diagram), and I hope they ran a 6 strands fiber at least and we will homerun both switches to the Core SW. We will keep the CAT5 (backup connection) Ethernet Cable from Park Central to Westhouse Core SW because it was helping us out many times already. Just in case... So the big difference will be in general, we will separate the Park Central and Westhouse Wireless Controllers to 2 x vSCG. 1 for Park Central and another for Westhouse, and will make 10G backbone with Wi-Fi6 APs. All of the AP locations will be kept in the same location, and we will replace the zf7982 WAPs with R750 WAPs, and all of the smaller zfxxxx series WAPs with R550s. The total AP count in Westhouse is 64. 60 R550, and 4 R750s. I will calculate the AP counts from the ZD because this is one to one swap, and replace the switches with the same switches they have now, so everything should be the same. MDF : 1 x Fusion SM- 400 10G Gateway 1 x Mikrotik Backup Gateway 64 x vSCG 64 APs - please check ZD for the locations (60 R550, 4 R750 WAPs at WH NYC) 1 x Brocade 7450-48P 8x10G Core SW 1 x UPS with web card 22nd Floor IDF: 1 x Brocade 7150-48PF 4x10G SW 1 x Brocade 7150-48PF 2x10G SW 1x Brocade 7150-24P 2x10G SW 1 x Brocade 7150-C12P 2x10G SW 1-to-1 swap APs - please check ZD for the locations (60 R550, 4 R750 WAPs at WH NYC) 1 x UPS

column52: Alex B went onsite and below are his notes: This is to install a FTG system at the Taj Boston hotel: Current FTG is thru Sonifi using the Dish Network. Coax cable is available in all the Guest rooms, along with 1 free outlet behind the TV. Recommend we install power strips to ensure we have plenty of power connections. Please note that the TV's will be mounted on a Swivel Bracket on the Wall after the renovation. Curretly the guest TV are on the dressor. The Beyond TV server will be installed in the 3rd floor MDF/Server room. The current Rack is on the left hand side once you walk into the server room. We will need to create two new SSID's on the ZD which are btvstreaming, and btvcasting with are standard password. Installing the Beyond TV device to the TV, please mount on the Wall behind TV. Connect the HDMI cable to HDMI1 using a 90 degree HDMI M/F adapter. this will remove any un needed tenssion on the HDMI cable. Connet the Chromecast device on HDMI 2 and connect a USB to A/C adapter for Power. Connect the MPI cable to the TV MPI port and then to the USB port on the Beyond TV STB. Tie down all cables to the TV using Velcoro not Zip Ties. Alexa will be connected to desk in a Suite, of if in a regular room the Dot will be intstalled on the nightstand next to the bed. If you are installing in the Alexa in a suite please install in the dot in the Bedroom and away form the TV. This is to provent any command issues from the guest. We want to provent the TV from sending audio commands to Alexa. Beyond TV STB: 1. Power up device and confirm that the latest firmware has been installed 2. continue the setup of the STB and select the correct Hotel and location of the device when stb is deployed. Example Bedroom, LivingRoom. 3. Continue with setup and when you get to the UI confirm that APPS have been installed and working. Confirm that the STB is connected to the correct ssid and the correct IP address. Confirm that Watchdog is installed. if not then you will need to select update tab and the stb will look for any updates. if some updates are found the box will install them and reboot. 4. Test live TV button, test volume and channel buttons. Test the Apps buttong on the remote and confirm that the STB responds by going to the apps. Test Chomecast app make sure it goes to HDMI 2 you should see the character from the movie frozen. Chromcast install: 1. Confim that you have the ssid btvcasting is broadcasting so the Chromcast can find the SSID and connect to it. 2. Make sure you connect the Chromcast device to a power outlet. Do not use the USB port on the TV, when the TV is off the USB Port is off. 2. Make sure you setup the device to the correct Google account and password. This information will can be attained by calling Trevor. 3. Setup the device accourding to HIS specification, if you need assistance you can call the NOC or the PM on the Project. Ferdinand's notes: We will be taking over the FTG using DirecTV and Groove doing the install. We will be installing the IPTV switches to support the IPTV network for our BTV 390 casting system. We need too install a Verimatrix server as they are going with Samsung TVs.

column52: Alex B went onsite and below are his notes: This is to install a FTG system at the Taj Boston hotel: Current FTG is thru Sonifi using the Dish Network. The current head in is in located in 3rd floor MDF/Server Room. Conduit runs from the Roof top to the MDF, there is room to pull cable thru them and there is a pull string. We will need 8 concret blocks to hold down the dish sled and run the simese RG6 solid copper, run the cables thru the wall and down the conduit. The new head in will be located on the 3rd floor in the MDF, please note that in the MDF, space is limited. I have asked for the Channel line up with the major and minor channels. Please see photos Beyond TV install: Currently there is 285 rooms, 375 TV's which are currently Samsung but are getting replaced with LG during the renovation. Coax cable is available in all the Guest rooms, along with 1 free outlet behind the TV. Recommend we install power strips to ensure we have plenty of power connections. Please note that the TV's will be mounted on a Swivel Bracket on the Wall after the renovation. Curretly the guest TV are on the dressor. The Beyond TV server will be installed in the 3rd floor MDF/Server room. The current Rack is on the left hand side once you walk into the server room. We will need to create two new SSID's on the ZD which are btvstreaming, and btvcasting with are standard password. Installing the Beyond TV device to the TV, please mount on the Wall behind TV. Connect the HDMI cable to HDMI1 using a 90 degree HDMI M/F adapter. this will remove any un needed tenssion on the HDMI cable. Connet the Chromecast device on HDMI 2 and connect a USB to A/C adapter for Power. Connect the MPI cable to the TV MPI port and then to the USB port on the Beyond TV STB. Tie down all cables to the TV using Velcoro not Zip Ties. Alexa will be connected to desk in a Suite, of if in a regular room the Dot will be intstalled on the nightstand next to the bed. If you are installing in the Alexa in a suite please install in the dot in the Bedroom and away form the TV. This is to provent any command issues from the guest. We want to provent the TV from sending audio commands to Alexa. Beyond TV STB: 1. Power up device and confirm that the latest firmware has been installed 2. continue the setup of the STB and select the correct Hotel and location of the device when stb is deployed. Example Bedroom, LivingRoom. 3. Continue with setup and when you get to the UI confirm that APPS have been installed and working. Confirm that the STB is connected to the correct ssid and the correct IP address. Confirm that Watchdog is installed. if not then you will need to select update tab and the stb will look for any updates. if some updates are found the box will install them and reboot. 4. Test live TV button, test volume and channel buttons. Test the Apps buttong on the remote and confirm that the STB responds by going to the apps. Test Chomecast app make sure it goes to HDMI 2 you should see the character from the movie frozen. Chromcast install: 1. Confim that you have the ssid btvcasting is broadcasting so the Chromcast can find the SSID and connect to it. 2. Make sure you connect the Chromcast device to a power outlet. Do not use the USB port on the TV, when the TV is off the USB Port is off. 2. Make sure you setup the device to the correct Google account and password. This information will can be attained by calling Trevor. 3. Setup the device accourding to HIS specification, if you need assistance you can call the NOC or the PM on the Project. Alexa install: When getting ready to deploy Alexa, here are a few things that must be done before deployment. 1. Connect Alexa Dot to a power outlet using the cable provided. 2. The dot will connect to the wireless SSID btvstreaming and will down load the updated firmware. 3. once completed confirm that the dot knows what hotel it is located in and the correct time. if any problems please inform Rachel and she will get with Volera. 4. the dot will have a service id label on the back of it, you will need to create a label with the room number that this device will be deployed to. Make sure you update the excel file that Rachel can provide to you so if will list the service ID and the Room number. Before you leave the Guest Room: 1. clean up, 2. test the TV with the RC-11 or 10 remote. Test volume and channels, Go to the UI and go to the Settings of the STB and confirm that the STB has the correct IP address and the latest firmware. 3. Test Chromcast make sure you can cast to the TV using your phone. 4. Test Alexa you want to make sure that the dot knows the correct hotel location, time for example. If it does not please communicate with Rachel and she will get with Volera. 5. Update documentation Ferdinand's notes: We will be taking over the FTG using DirecTV. We will be installing the IPTV switches to support the IPTV network for our BTV 390 casting system. The client would also like for us to sell them 287 Alexa Dots to go into all rooms on property.

column52: Alex B went onsite and below are his notes: This is to install a FTG system at the Taj Boston hotel: Current FTG is thru Sonifi using the Dish Network. The current head in is in located in 3rd floor MDF/Server Room. Conduit runs from the Roof top to the MDF, there is room to pull cable thru them and there is a pull string. We will need 8 concret blocks to hold down the dish sled and run the simese RG6 solid copper, run the cables thru the wall and down the conduit. The new head in will be located on the 3rd floor in the MDF, please note that in the MDF, space is limited. I have asked for the Channel line up with the major and minor channels. Please see photos Beyond TV install: Currently there is 285 rooms, 375 TV's which are currently Samsung but are getting replaced with LG during the renovation. Coax cable is available in all the Guest rooms, along with 1 free outlet behind the TV. Recommend we install power strips to ensure we have plenty of power connections. Please note that the TV's will be mounted on a Swivel Bracket on the Wall after the renovation. Curretly the guest TV are on the dressor. The Beyond TV server will be installed in the 3rd floor MDF/Server room. The current Rack is on the left hand side once you walk into the server room. We will need to create two new SSID's on the ZD which are btvstreaming, and btvcasting with are standard password. Installing the Beyond TV device to the TV, please mount on the Wall behind TV. Connect the HDMI cable to HDMI1 using a 90 degree HDMI M/F adapter. this will remove any un needed tenssion on the HDMI cable. Connet the Chromecast device on HDMI 2 and connect a USB to A/C adapter for Power. Connect the MPI cable to the TV MPI port and then to the USB port on the Beyond TV STB. Tie down all cables to the TV using Velcoro not Zip Ties. Alexa will be connected to desk in a Suite, of if in a regular room the Dot will be intstalled on the nightstand next to the bed. If you are installing in the Alexa in a suite please install in the dot in the Bedroom and away form the TV. This is to provent any command issues from the guest. We want to provent the TV from sending audio commands to Alexa. Beyond TV STB: 1. Power up device and confirm that the latest firmware has been installed 2. continue the setup of the STB and select the correct Hotel and location of the device when stb is deployed. Example Bedroom, LivingRoom. 3. Continue with setup and when you get to the UI confirm that APPS have been installed and working. Confirm that the STB is connected to the correct ssid and the correct IP address. Confirm that Watchdog is installed. if not then you will need to select update tab and the stb will look for any updates. if some updates are found the box will install them and reboot. 4. Test live TV button, test volume and channel buttons. Test the Apps buttong on the remote and confirm that the STB responds by going to the apps. Test Chomecast app make sure it goes to HDMI 2 you should see the character from the movie frozen. Chromcast install: 1. Confim that you have the ssid btvcasting is broadcasting so the Chromcast can find the SSID and connect to it. 2. Make sure you connect the Chromcast device to a power outlet. Do not use the USB port on the TV, when the TV is off the USB Port is off. 2. Make sure you setup the device to the correct Google account and password. This information will can be attained by calling Trevor. 3. Setup the device accourding to HIS specification, if you need assistance you can call the NOC or the PM on the Project. Alexa install: When getting ready to deploy Alexa, here are a few things that must be done before deployment. 1. Connect Alexa Dot to a power outlet using the cable provided. 2. The dot will connect to the wireless SSID btvstreaming and will down load the updated firmware. 3. once completed confirm that the dot knows what hotel it is located in and the correct time. if any problems please inform Rachel and she will get with Volera. 4. the dot will have a service id label on the back of it, you will need to create a label with the room number that this device will be deployed to. Make sure you update the excel file that Rachel can provide to you so if will list the service ID and the Room number. Before you leave the Guest Room: 1. clean up, 2. test the TV with the RC-11 or 10 remote. Test volume and channels, Go to the UI and go to the Settings of the STB and confirm that the STB has the correct IP address and the latest firmware. 3. Test Chromcast make sure you can cast to the TV using your phone. 4. Test Alexa you want to make sure that the dot knows the correct hotel location, time for example. If it does not please communicate with Rachel and she will get with Volera. 5. Update documentation Ferdinand's notes: We will be taking over the FTG using DirecTV. We will be installing the IPTV switches to support the IPTV network for our BTV 390 casting system. The client would also like for us to sell them 70 Alexa Dots to go into the select suites at the property.
